item.title: Tate brothers arrive in US after Romania prosecutors lift travel ban
item.description: The pair, facing a rape and trafficking trial, had been banned from leaving Romania in recent years.

item.title: Thailand deports dozens of Uyghurs to China
item.description: The move comes after rights groups warned the Uyghurs face torture and possibly death back in China.

item.title: Gene Hackman and his wife Betsy Arakawa found dead at their home
item.description: Hackman, 95, and his wife Betsy Arakawa, 63, appeared to have been dead for some time when their bodies were discovered.

item.title: Jailed Kurdish leader issues call to lay down arms
item.description: Abdullah Ocalan had earlier met pro-Kurdish MPs on an island where he has been in jail since 1999.

item.title: Why are the Tate brothers in the US?
item.description: Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan have left Romania, where they were previously under a travel ban.
